text: Hi everyone. I have what I think is a simple question. If I create a HubDB that has a URL type field for linking up to existing pages and my markup just pulls in that field as the href, what structure is that field expecting? Is it expecting the entire URL, anything after the root domain, or will it take any of the URL parts depending on what page that item is viewed on? Does anyone know?
gotcha. I was seeing some different behaviors so I was not for sure what the best practice was for using that type of field in a HubDB
if you do use just a fragment, say the main url after the root domain, will it take on whatever parts of the url / page that the ‘item’ is viewed from?
I belive is will use the url as if you were adding it manually into the markup
if it looks like this `link/page.html` if will use the current page as its base
if it looks like this: `/link/page.html` it will use the current domain as its base
then a absolute url works how youd expect
